summary: This is an email chain from August 22, 2019, between a Special Agent from the Office of the Inspector General and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. They are coordinating interviews for the following week related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The email mentions that a lawyer for an unnamed individual is ready to meet regarding the death investigation.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: Special Agent, Office of the Inspector General
persons.context: Correspondent in the email chain, coordinating interview dates for the MCC/Epstein death investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Primary sender of the initial email, requesting coordination of interviews for the MCC/Epstein death investigation.

connections.description: Coordinating interview schedules for the Epstein death investigation on behalf of their respective offices (OIG and US Attorney's Office).

events.title: Coordination of MCC Interviews
events.description: Email correspondence to schedule interviews for the following week with several individuals as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the MCC.

locations: New York Field Office (Office of the Inspector General)
keyFacts: The email is dated August 22, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The correspondence is part of the official investigation into Epstein's death while in custody at the MCC.
An unnamed individual's lawyer is reported to be ready to meet with investigators the following week.
The email lists five individuals for potential interviews, with two marked as 'low priority'.
The coordination involves multiple agencies: the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY), the Office of the Inspector General (OIG), and the FBI.
